title.value: Mitigating Calibration Bias Without Fixed Attribute Grouping for Improved Fairness in Medical Imaging Analysis

title.quote: Mitigating Calibration Bias Without Fixed Attribute Grouping for Improved Fairness in Medical Imaging Analysis

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel two-stage method called Cluster-Focal to address calibration biases in deep learning models for medical imaging analysis. This method identifies poorly calibrated samples, clusters them, and then applies a group-wise focal loss to improve calibration biases without needing predefined subgroup attributes. The approach is evaluated on skin lesion classification and predicting future lesional activity for multiple sclerosis patients, showing improved fairness and calibration performance compared to other methods.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results and evaluations of the proposed method on different datasets, indicating it is empirical.
type.quote: Our results demonstrate that our method effectively controls calibration error in the worst-performing subgroups while preserving prediction performance, and outperforming recent baselines.
